data.title: Planet Earth Blog — Blog — www.barberousse.pro
data.meta_description: www.barberousse.pro is the personal website of James M. Barberousse
data.text:
Things Getting Strange

August 3, 2024

I don’t know about you, but to me things are getting strange around here, the world and all. I’m sure I’m not alone in echoing the immortal words of Marvin Gaye in his 1971 hit: “What’s Going On?” So, what’s going on? I’m not sure. But as for me, I’m finishing up work on my […]

Einstein’s Riddle

February 4, 2024

This is a famous riddle: There are five houses lined up next to each other along a street. Each house is a different color, and each homeowner is of a different nationality, drinks a different beverage, smokes a different brand of cigar, and owns a different pet. If these variables can never repeat from house […]

Christmas 2023

December 26, 2023

Christmas is here! Finally! Although, really Advent seemed to go by in a flash. And we got a White Christmas. We weren’t just dreaming of a white Christmas, we got one, and it was lovely. We didn’t get a lot but a pretty dusting like a present given on Christmas morn. And from Midnight Mass: […]

Almost Christmas!

December 16, 2023

Looking back at my last post on September 30, I was saying it was almost October. Well, now it’s almost Christmas! Wow! This tells me two things: First, that I don’t update this blog very often! Second, that time is moving faster than fast these days!! So, given that, I hope your Christmas preparations are […]

Almost October

September 30, 2023

It’s amazing to think about, but time has really been flying by lately! God did say that He would speed up time, and He wasn’t lying (not that God would). Time’s a movin’ on, as someone might have said once. Anyway, that’s all I really wanted to say right now. I’ll catch you next time, […]

11/22/63

April 11, 2023

Book Review Well, I finally did it. I read (to the very end) Stephen King’s massive novel, 11/22/63. I say finally, because I had checked this book out of the library before but had never gotten past reading the back cover, maybe out of fear of the time commitment involved in reading it. How can […]

New Year 2023

January 15, 2023

I hope everyone enjoyed celebrating Christmas, the birth of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ! And what now? Well, a new year has dawned, so let’s make the most of it!

11 Days ‘Till Christmas

December 14, 2022

There are now only 11 days until Christmas, one day fewer than yesterday! But how the time creeps by. If only it were now.

12 Days ‘Till Christmas!

December 13, 2022

There are only 12 days until Christmas, the birth of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ! If you’re not already deep into preparations for the arrival of the King, delay no longer and begin now.

Thanksgiving

November 25, 2022

Well, it’s the day after Thanksgiving and all through the house, not a belly was empty not even a mouse’s. Nice start to a poem! Now what? I’ve never been much of a poet, but I appreciate a good rhyme anytime. My apologies to Clement Clarke Moore.
